intro: Blakwellia brachystylis, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed blakwellia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its compact stature and dense foliage make it an attractive species for native gardens. Blakwellia brachystylis is also notable for its role in supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
